form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Cortez Masto (for herself and Mr. Budd) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2000 to extend and modify requirements for an annual report on military and security developments involving the People’s Republic of China.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the China Military Power Transparency Act of 2025.

section.header: Extension and modification of annual report on military and security developments involving the People’s Republic of China

subsection.text: Subsection (a) of section 1202 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2000 (10 U.S.C. 113 note) is amended by striking January 31, 2027 and inserting January 31, 2030.
Subsection (b) of such section is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3)(C), by striking the period at the end and inserting , including nuclear and drone development cooperation.;
in paragraph (7)(A), by inserting , including foreign farmland acquisitions, after Chinese overseas investments or projects;

subparagraph.text: by striking infrastructure) and and inserting infrastructure),; and
by striking the period at the end and inserting , and the likely role of Chinese cyber capabilities in a conflict with the United States.;

paragraph.text: in paragraph (9)(B), by striking and other advanced technologies and inserting biotechnology, and other advanced and emerging technologies; and

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking and at the end;
by redesignating subparagraph (B) as subparagraph (C); and
by inserting after subparagraph (A) the following new subparagraph (B):

the likely strategic intent of the People’s Liberation Army in a conflict over Taiwan, and how the People’s Republic of China will conduct a cyber enabled economic warfare campaign, a cross straight invasion campaign, or a blockade campaign; and
